column4: hi people! a friend of mine has installed open-suse after ubuntu as a dual-boot, but it has fcked up his grub-menu now. is it possible to repair the ubuntu grub from a live-cd?

it can be done, I don't think you need the live cd, unless you can't boot either OS, anyway, I will give you a hint, edit the grub.menu file or something like that, and then run grub-update or somthing like that
thanks, will try that now
there is no grub-update. mb grub-setup?
I never did it lately, otherwise I would give you the precise file names, but you ls /boot and see the new names
well, neither of the OS is booting, so if I use the live-CD, would I have to mount the disc first?
when you boot the live cd, it will mount it, Do not umount it
I mean, the hd partition where my ubuntu is installed
oh okay, thanks
yeah, you will probably have to mount boot, to edit that boot.menu file, find someone else or google for the exact file names.  let me check one sec
if you type grub and hit tab, you will see lots of apps
yeah I can see them, and I think grub-setup is the one, right?
yeah, but better google instructions first
oki, thanks
I can't find the file, menu.lst, that is the one you wanna edit, and include both the suse and ubuntu kernels
yeah, karmic doesnot have that..
well let me know how you did it when you are done if you feel like it.  I am trying to run two webcams at once
sure I will, thanks for all the support man, appreciate
I got it working, just followed this guide here :) https://help.ubuntu.com/community/RecoveringUbuntuAfterInstallingWindows
that was fast, well done
thanks a lot for the help and attention =)
appreciate
